item.title: Overgrown Trees, 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Sand/Cement on pavement, 19th June
item.description:
There is sand and cement all over pavement, which is being walked into the house. This is happening continually. We have already had to clean our driveway and windows.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clive Avenue, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household items near yellow rubbish bin, 19th June
item.description:
Near project protein shop and turning into Lynmere Road. Access to pavement around the bin and pavements of surrounding roads is restricted due to amount of items being loosely dumped and not bagged up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynmere Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin collectors deliberately leaving rubbish all over street., 19th June
item.description:
The bin collection this morning is absolutely disgusting and disgraceful. The guys chucked the bags into the middle of the road and when then split they drove off and left an absolute mess on Perch Street and April Street. They do this so often.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Perch Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath, London

item.title: There are lime bikes blocking 54 Baker Street fire exit and pavement and also the bikes are parked close to the traffic crossing., 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Bin flytipped at bottom of alley, 19th June
item.description:
Our CCTV shows bin dumped at 21 48 on Tuesday night by a person who walked from the right and then was picked up by a silver car. Unfortunately can't see car registration number. Thanks for your help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Trees in need of water, 19th June
item.description:
Has the tree watering round stopped? Last year newly planted trees were watered regularly. There are now many dead or suffering young trees in Park Langley.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Wickham Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards NOT WORKING AGAIN!!!!, 19th June
item.description:
The bollards at the corner of John Adam St and Villiers St are not closing correctly again with one bollard not moving at all and the other bollard taking forever to close. This is the 4th instance in as many weeks and one wonders how hard this is to fix!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9-11, Villiers Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch fallen into St Mary's Churchyard, 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish on Pavement and Road, 19th June
item.description:
Bags of rubbish dumped on Myrtledene Road (near the junction with Camrose Street). Subsequently ripped open and now rubbish including food items all over pavement and road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Myrtledene Road, Abbey Wood, London
